Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> Agree. Competition from good teams will only increase... I'm predicting a rough road to HushNG. So we dead, imo.

Trade volume on cryptopia doesnt mean anything to me. Have you tried to trade hush? Have you seen the chart? There has been no liquidity on the buy side (except for a 2 day pump) since the top. 

If you're going to refer to the trade volume as a way to say this coin is not dead, might as well look at the chart which shows price as well. And you can see from the chart, we are dead on that front (trading), too. Whoever sold the top hasn't come back in- at all. There is no real trading going on. Once it broke long term support, trading died.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <LocoMB> aside from privacy, what special features does HUSH have?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <Eddy O> 51% attack protection, openly asic friendly

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @LocoMB we also have bitcore merged, which most Zcash forks (nor Zcash itself) have merged

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that gives us lots of extra indexes, like the one that powers `getsnapshot`

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> we also have TLS/SSL, which many coins don't have

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> or "secure" nodes are not tied to some masternode program, anybody can run a secure node

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> `getsnapshot` is a new RPC I just ported from KMD, that allows you to generate a richlist extremely fast

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and also, at a certain block height, so you can see changes to the richlist, study where the funds are moving around to so much easier

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it used to be lots + lots of custom code + data munging to get this data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <LocoMB> üëç

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <passcombo.com üè¥‚ò†üçã> studying richlist changes is not much a privacy idea though üòõ

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you don't want your activities studied, then use zaddrs üòà

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> there are many reasons to study a richlist, to see how many active addresses there are, how many have over X value, what % of addresses own 90% of circulation, etc

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 15 seconds to generate a Hush richlist, sweet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> ```  "total": 5168136.64601297,
  "average": 179.3993335184671,
  "utxos": 1505401,
  "total_addresses": 28808,
  "ignored_addresses": 0,
  "start_height": 412499,
  "ending_height": 412499,
  "end_time": 1542052042```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> you have no idea how hard that data was to generate, before `getsnapshot`. It was like smelting your own metal to make a knife

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> now there is a knife factory

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <rikst> how this option could be sold/used for smth?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's useful for analysis

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> like, if you wanted to compare how many addresses have ever been used on Zcash versus Hush, or any other coin

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> it's not for average users, it's for developers and people studying the privacy/metrics of your public blockchain

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> zaddrs are hidden

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> nobody can know their balances

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> if you don't want your wealth to show up in a richlist, use a zaddr

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> the average address has 179.4 HUSH in it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> 28808 addresses have ever been used on Hush public blockchain. It's interesting data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> and to clarify, that average does not include zaddrs, all of this data is only about taddrs

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> dexstats.info, which hosts richlists for all KMD coins, says they will add Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so we will have a constantly up-to-date richlist at least, somewhere

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> that is run by CHMEX, who is an awesome person

Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/MyHush/hush/pull/154
